definitions.text: an abstract idea of that which is due to a person or governmental body by law or tradition or nature; ; - Eleanor Roosevelt
examples: they are endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable Rights
Certain rights can never be granted to the government but must be kept in the hands of the people
a right is not something that somebody gives you; it is something that nobody can take away

definitions.text: location near or direction toward the right side; i.e. the side to the south when a person or object faces east
the piece of ground in the outfield on the catcher's right
those who support political or social or economic conservatism; those who believe that things are better left unchanged
the hand that is on the right side of the body
examples: he writes with his right hand but pitches with his left
hit him with quick rights to the body

definitions.text: a turn toward the side of the body that is on the south when the person is facing east
examples: take a right at the corner

definitions.text: anything in accord with principles of justice
examples: he feels he is in the right

definitions.text: (frequently plural) the interest possessed by law or custom in some intangible thing
make reparations or amends for
examples: right a wrongs done to the victims of the Holocaust

definitions.text: put in or restore to an upright position
examples: They righted the sailboat that had capsized

definitions.text: regain an upright or proper position
make right or correct
being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north
examples: the right bank of a river is the bank on your right side when you are facing downstream

definitions.text: free from error; especially conforming to fact or truth
socially right or correct
examples: it isn't right to leave the party without saying goodbye

definitions.text: in conformance with justice or law or morality
examples: do the right thing and confess

definitions.text: correct in opinion or judgment
appropriate for a condition or purpose or occasion or a person's character, needs
examples: the right man for the job
she is not suitable for the position

definitions.text: of or belonging to the political or intellectual right
in or into a satisfactory condition
intended for the right hand
in accord with accepted standards of usage or procedure
examples: what's the right word for this?
the right way to open oysters

definitions.text: having the axis perpendicular to the base
(of the side of cloth or clothing) facing or intended to face outward
examples: the right side of the cloth showed the pattern
be sure your shirt is right side out

definitions.text: most suitable or right for a particular purpose
examples: a good time to plant tomatoes
the time is ripe for great sociological changes

definitions.text: precisely accurate
precisely, exactly
immediately
exactly
examples: he fell flop on his face

definitions.text: toward or on the right; also used figuratively
in the right manner
an interjection expressing agreement
completely
examples: he fell right into the trap

definitions.text: (Southern regional intensive) very; to a great degree
examples: that boy is powerful big now
they have a right nice place

definitions.text: in accordance with moral or social standards
in an accurate manner
examples: the flower had been correctly depicted by his son
